alert.note: Alert for Rutland; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 18 at 5:20PM EDT until July 18 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR EASTERN RUTLAND AND SOUTH CENTRAL WINDSOR COUNTIES... At 520 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chester, Ludlow, Ludlow Village, Andover, Cavendish, Weston, Baltimore, Mount Holly, Reading, Plymouth, Proctorsville, Gassetts, Simonsville, Whitesville, Cavendish Center and Tyson. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
